channel.description: Join 9,100+ testers and subscribe for the best Software Testing news in your inbox. Every week â€” for free!

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 277 - Jul 2nd 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬277æ¡ - 7æœˆ2æ—¥2025
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 277th issue!

AI is now commonly used to create code. So how's the experience of testing it?

I want to share with you some recent thoughts about that from testers and developers:

  • Testing AI-coded applications: Practical tips for software testers by Rafaela Azevedo,
  • When ChatGPT Writes the Code â€” and Everyone Thinks It's Perfect by Yuliia Baranetska,
  • A programmer yelling at the clouds about vibe coding by Daniel Draper.

In short â€” pay more attention. ğŸ™‚

Happy testing!

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

2025 Buyer's Guide to ERP Testing

84% of ERP projects miss expectations, and testing is a major reason why. The 2025 Buyer's Guide shows how to modernize your testing strategy with AI, boost coverage, and reduce risk. Get the insights that QA and IT leaders are acting on.

opkey.com

NEWS

Don't Just Deliver Software. Deliver Confidence

Sarat Ramineni correctly points out why QA should be a core part of product strategy, not just a final step in development.

Similarly, Alessandra Moreira shares a great reminder about the impact of Engineering Team Culture and Code Quality.

medium.com

How Root Cause Labels Helped Me Uncover Process Gaps and Build a Quality Culture

Struggling to understand where your bugs come from? Mona M. Abd El-Rahman shows a good example of building a root cause analysis process in practice.

medium.com

Value of QA roles after AI

What impact will AI have on the QA role? It's a valid question, and you can find out what other testers think based on this discussion.

In another thread, someone shared a belief that QA deserves more than just being the last line of defence, which resonated with others.

reddit.com

Why QA Must Be Involved From Day One

In Agile, I can't imagine testers working outside of the teams or joining in the late stages of the software development life cycle. Ahmed El-Deeb highlights well why it's important.

Moreover, George Ukkuru describes The Seven Hats of a Test Engineer in modern software development.

medium.com

AUTOMATION

QA Decisions, When to Automate Tests, and When to Walk Away: A Practical Guide for Effective Test Automation

How do you decide when and what to automate? If you struggle to answer that, listen to Marina JordÃ£o's helpful advice.

At the same time, Niraj Subedi reminds us What Automation Misses: Bugs Manual Testing Still Finds Every Day.

medium.com

Scaling Test Automation: From Dozens to Thousands of Tests

If you want to prepare to run your test suite at scale, Peyman Iravani wrote a comprehensive guide with plenty of JavaScript code examples.

But remember that 100% of Test Coverage Is Not About the Amount of Tests, as Andrei Trukhin explains.

medium.com

Test Doubles in Python: A Guide to Mocking

In previous newsletters, I've featured several articles about test doubles, such as mocks, stubs and fakes. But I haven't covered how to do that in Python yet. Well, today is the day, thanks to Bruce Ho!

medium.com

What Your Broken Test Suite Is Really Telling You

Another good read from Alessandra Moreira describing the possible problems and anti-patterns you may find during test automation, offering tips on how to improve them.

Some remedy to that might be Bad Test Hunting â€” Mutation Testing, as Edgars GarÅ¡neks outlines.

roadlesstested.com

TOOLS

7 Open Source Projects That Are Revolutionizing QA with AI

Last week, I highlighted an open-source solution for AI test automation. This time, you can learn about more projects thanks to Faris Kurnia.

Furthermore, Mohammad Faisal Khatri put together a handy collection of Top GitHub Repositories to Learn Automation Testing.

medium.com

Advanced Parameter Types and Smart Data Table Handling in Cucumber

Using Cucumber? In this comprehensive article, Irfan MujagiÄ‡ gives several practical tips on how to improve the maintenance of tests.

thegreenreport.blog

PactumJS in Practice: Using Data Templates to Manage Test Data â€” Part 1

Eleonora Belova has just started a series of articles about API testing with PactumJS. You can also read the second part.

noraweisser.com

The 'second' most abused (and misused) Cypress command ever: cy.contains()

How often do you use cy.contains() in Cypress? Sebastian Clavijo Suero explains various scenarios in which there might be a better way.

Furthermore, Josh Grant explains Why I Love Get By Text in Playwright.

dev.to

VIDEOS

8 Skills for Automation Engineers

Whether you want to get into test automation or you're already on that path, you may benefit from the skills that Daniel Knott describes in detail in this 23-minute video.

youtube.com

Playwright TypeScript - Part 8: API Testing Using Playwright

Continuing the series of recordings about testing with Playwright, this time Alex Khvastovich shows how to test APIs with that tool.

Furthermore, Karthik K.K. demonstrates how to Automate Complex API Tests with Just One Command using Playwright MCP.

youtube.com

AND...

That's AGI... ğŸ¤£

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 273 - Jun 5th 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬273æœŸ - 2025å¹´6æœˆ5æ—¥
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 273rd issue!

A few weeks ago, I shared advice on how to start a career in software testing.

Today, I want to highlight a discussion that touches the core of becoming a tester:

You want to be a QA, why?

There are great insights from people who are already working in the field, as well as those who want to break into it.

Happy testing! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

The 2025 State of Testing in DevOps Report

mabl's 6th State of Testing in DevOps Report explores the impact of software testing, test automation, organizational growth, and DevOps maturity across the software development lifecycle. Read the report here.

mabl.com

NEWS

From Junior to Senior Test Engineer: The Mindset Shifts That Matter

How does the tester's role change with career progression? It's more than just the responsibilities. It's also about the way of thinking, as Anthony Mcpherson explains.

Also, Gilles Capdivila shares great insights into Introducing quality in a company that didn't have the culture.

medium.com

The Primacy of Primary Testing

Have you heard of Prospective and Primary Testing? I haven't, and I'm intrigued to learn about both concepts coined by Michael Bolton.

On top of that, Lorin Hochstein explains why The same incident never happens twice, but the patterns recur over and over.

developsense.com

Why the testing industry is the way it is

Testing practices and trends have evolved over time. Lee Hawkins gives us good historical context and explains the impact of AI so far.

Moreover, I enjoyed Joep Schuurkes's sobering thoughts on: How essential are your testers?

wordpress.com

Why Your Quality Metrics Might Be Lying to You

Mona M. Abd El-Rahman shares some valuable advice on how to be more precise in providing metrics regarding testing and quality. You can read more in the second part â€” Stop Lying to Yourself: Measure Quality That Impacts Users.

medium.com

AUTOMATION

Lessons learned in test-driven development: Software tester edition

Arun Vishwanathan shares very interesting insights into Test-Driven Development from the perspective of an SDET at Apple.

ministryoftesting.com

On No/Low Code and AI for Automation, Testing, and Quality Engineering

There has been an increasing number of both low-code and full-code testing solutions. AI seems to be accelerating that trend, and Cassandra H. Leung describes her thoughts on that.

Also, do you feel the AI Implementation pressure in QA as well?

cassandrahl.com

Pick E2E Tests To Run Using AI Summaries

Having a smart, selective test running based on code changes is a great approach for bigger test suites. Gleb Bahmutov shows how to leverage AI to achieve that with Cypress tests.

Moreover, Divya Singla wrote an interesting article about Generating Test Cases from User Behaviour: Is AI Ready?.

glebbahmutov.com

Software Test Automation: Learning Roadmap, Why it is Important and How AI Can Help

If you want to learn about test automation but you don't know where to start, this detailed roadmap by Yingya Wang can help you get started and keep going.

Similarly, someone on Reddit shared a comprehensive Checklist of what to learn for Automation that was praised by the community.

medium.com

Why I Don't Use Page Object Model (POM) in Small Mobile Automation Projects

Page Object Model is commonly used in test automation. But as Niraj Subedi explains, there are situations where it might not be the best choice.

Also, here's an interesting discussion â€” Are well-structured XPaths still considered bad practice?

medium.com

Why Shouldn't You Use Mocks?

I liked this clear, logical explanation of test doubles from dummies to mocks by Maicon Jobim and why the latter may make tests less clear.

Also, Muhammad Hilal Darul Fauzan wrote about Mock Objects & Stubs: Your Key to Bulletproof Test Isolation.

medium.com

TOOLS

AI-Powered Test Automation: Part 2â€” iOS Mobile Testing with MCP (mobile-mcp)

Predictably, MCP has arrived on mobile, too! Ismail Sobhy demonstrates a few scenarios of using mobile-mcp to navigate and test mobile apps with AI.

medium.com

Let's Explore the Best REST API Clients and Testing Tools (2025 Edition)

Looking for an API testing client? Erik MiloÅ¡eviÄ‡ listed out 15 possible options ranging from GUI-based to code-based tools.

medium.com

Readable RSpec output for reviewers, with one command

One of the biggest advantages of RSpec test runner for Ruby is the clear way of describing tests. IhcÃ¨ne Medjber shows how you can generate a summary of tests without executing them using the --dry-run mode.

medium.com

Sprinkle Some Syntactic Sugar on Your Tests With TypeScript Decorators

Writing tests in TypeScript? Harmeet Singh put together a handy guide on how to implement test decorators that can be used for test tagging, for example.

Speaking of which, Sebastian Attard describes Smarter Cypress Testing with Tags: How @cypress/grep Simplified My Workflow.

medium.com

Supercharging Playwright Tests with Chrome DevTools Protocol

Irfan MujagiÄ‡ explains how to effectively use Chrome DevTools Protocol features in advanced testing with Playwright.

Moreover, Rajesh Sharma presents The .or() Trick in Playwright POM: A QA's Shortcut to Reusable and Cleaner Code.

thegreenreport.blog

VIDEOS

Boost Your Testing Workflow with Playwright's PW-API-PLUGIN

In this 16-minute video, Joan Esquivel Montero demonstrates pw-api-plugin that enables comprehensive API testing and result presentation using the Playwright UI, Trace Viewer, and HTML Report.

youtube.com

Is BDD Dead? How AI Is Bringing It Back to Life!

Karthik K.K. briefly shows how to leverage BDD scenarios to create tests with AI.

youtube.com

AND...

That went well... ğŸ˜‚

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 274 - Jun 11th 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬274æœŸ - 2025å¹´6æœˆ11æ—¥
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 274th issue!

What is software testing really about?

There've been a lot of thoughts shared on this topic, but this recent article stood out to me:

A complete philosophy of software testing in under 50 words.

I liked how Paul Martin found a pragmatic way to describe it.

Enjoy and happy testing! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

"My experience with Testmo has been nothing but positive"

Read more about why the Huge, Inc. QA team decided to stop using Google Sheets for testing, how they evaluated multiple test management solutions, and why they ultimately chose Testmo, including:

  • Testmo's support team,
  • Testmo's ease of use,
  • Testmo's flexible and affordable pricing.

testmo.com

NEWS

Day 0 as a QA Engineer in a Company That Never Had One

Wondering what challenges await the first tester in a company? Marina JordÃ£o shares her experience and advises what to do.

And importantly, Ahmed El-Deeb outlines Why Your Team Structure Is Killing Quality and Silencing QA.

medium.com

From Quality Assurance to Quality Advocate

A great piece by Kelly Chin on the evolving roles of testers and the importance of coaching team members and embedding QA early.

Similarly, Niraj Subedi explains why QA Is Not Just a Role â€” It's a Responsibility.

medium.com

How to get unstuck: A guide for testers or anyone else who feels stumped

There's a lot of context switching in our jobs. Sometimes it can be overwhelming and we get stuck. Here's some great advice from Ady Stokes on how to overcome that.

ministryoftesting.com

Test Planning â€” What Makes A Good Plan?

"If you fail to plan, you're planning to fail." â€” goes the saying. Gil Zilberfeld has some good hints on how to plan testing well.

Also, it's important to practice Risk-Based Testing: When Time is Tight, Test Smart, as Sinem Merve Ozdemir points out.

everydayunittesting.com

The AI 4-Shot Testing Flow

This is a very interesting post by Jason Arbon on how AI-assisted hybrid testing can help software engineering teams become more efficient.

Also, Mark Winteringham wrote a brilliant article on When not to use AI.

medium.com

AUTOMATION

Are You Over-Engineering Your Tests?

Test automation can make testing more efficient, but it can also backfire when not done correctly. Kristin Jackvony describes a few reasons for this.

In that context, Jeff Thoensen shares several practical Lessons from My Automation Journey.

thinkingtester.com

Flaky Tests: When Perfection Becomes the Enemy of Progress

How do you solve test flakiness at scale? Omar Chouikh gives an overview of an intriguing approach to detecting common flakiness issues, initially presented by Maxime ClÃ©ment from Docker.

medium.com

Refactor or Rewrite? Making the Right Call in Test Automation

When working on legacy test automation projects, you may face a dilemma â€” should I improve or replace it? Krishna Chaitanya points out what to consider when making that decision.

Similarly, Hannah G. Anulur has some good tips on How to Reduce Refactoring in Test Automation.

medium.com

Vibe coding web frontend tests â€” from mocked to actual tests

How accurate is AI at testing web apps by itself? This is an interesting series of articles by Heemeng Foo exploring its limitations and possibilities.

medium.com

TOOLS

Centralized Playwright API Logs with Grafana Loki

If you want to get more insights from your Playwright API tests, Indra Aristya shows how to build a logging system with Grafana Loki.

Furthermore, James Kip gives a tip on addressing some flaky tests by Waiting on GraphQL: Reliable Handling of In-Flight Requests in Playwright.

medium.com

Modern Test Automation with AI and Playwright MCP

In this detailed overview, Kailash Pathak demonstrates how to effectively use AI and Playwright MCP server to write tests for web apps.

Similarly, Andrey Enin shares his efforts with Generative Automation Testing with Playwright MCP Server.

medium.com

Orderly Ape â€” an open-source tool to run k6 load tests across multiple Kubernetes clusters

Using k6 for load testing? You may like this open-source solution by Kevin Ohashi to orchestrate and run them on several clusters.

github.com

Proven Best Practices for Building Reliable APIs with REST Assured

REST Assured is a popular tool for testing APIs in Java. Nitika Singh shares a few tips on how to use it effectively, followed by Java Best Practices for Test Automation.

medium.com

Setting Up MCP Server with Playwright: A Complete Integration Guide

In a series of articles, Peyman Iravani demonstrates building an AI-powered test automation solution with a custom MCP implementation for Playwright, self-healing logic, test reports and support for AI, DB and UI testing. You can find the repository here: Falcon-Automation.

medium.com

VIDEOS

What Are We Thinking in the Age of AI? And are we still thinking like testers?

This is an insightful overview from Michael Bolton on the impact of AI on testing with advice on when and when not to use it.

youtube.com

When it is time to move on to a new job in QA

In this 11-minute recording, Alex Khvastovich gives career progression advice for testers based on personal reflection.

youtube.com

AND...

Gen Z bug reports... ğŸ˜‚

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 275 - Jun 16th 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬275æœŸ - 2025å¹´6æœˆ16æ—¥
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 275th issue!

The extensive Software Testing and Quality Report (4th Edition) from TestRail is out.

Among many insights, I found these to be the most interesting:

  • AI: ChatGPT and GitHub Copilot are the most popular solutions, but surprisingly, the adoption of AI is mixed, with most responders claiming that AI has had minimal impact on their role.
  • Tools: Selenium is still the most widely used test automation tool (39%), followed by Playwright (19%) and Cypress (16%).
  • Priority: The top priorities of testers are increasing test coverage, preventing bugs, and test automation. But more interestingly, including more stakeholders in the testing process is the lowest priority.

You can also read two write-ups here and here.

Happy testing! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

Inside Paramount's Secret to Bulletproof Streaming Analytics

Join Paramount and Testlio live on July 10th to discover how Paramount prevents silent failures in analytics that can ripple through revenue, reporting, and partner relationships. Save your spot today!

testlio.com

NEWS

3 Critical Software Testing Challenges in Product Development

I can relate to the three main problems in testing that Arik Aharoni brought up here based on his broad experience. Unsurprisingly, they're not technical, but cultural.

In this context, Alessandra Moreira wrote a good article explaining that You Can't Scale Software Quality Without Team Buy In.

testuff.com

A Reflection After 7 Years in the QA Field

Aditya Putra Pratama describes two common QA mindsets and explains why it's important to shift from the reactive to the strategic one.

Also, someone from the testing community noticed that So many people interested in QA are looking for shortcuts.

medium.com

Orienting test planning

A thought-provoking article by Paul Martin that greatly explains why you should consider risks, strategy and scope during test planning.

Moreover, Elena Voevodkina describes the pros and cons of the Zero Bug Policy: How Testers Survive and Thrive as part of the testing culture.

medium.com

Quality at Scale: How Google Keeps Bugs in Check Across Billions of Lines

Bhagwati Malav shares insights into Google's test strategy, providing historical context that led to the current state.

Very similarly, Ivan Boklach describes the Story of How Google Learned to Test.

substack.com

Sub-Zero Shot: The Early Peek That's Revolutionizing Software Testing

Following the overview of the AI 4-Shot Testing Flow that I featured last week, Jason Arbon describes each stage in more detail. You can also read more about the Zero-Shot, One-Shot and Two-Shot stages.

medium.com

AUTOMATION

Do we need to write polymorphism, inheritance and constructors in test frameworks?

Some of you may wonder whether the object-oriented programming practices should be applied to test code. Well, here's what the community thinks.

reddit.com

Tech leads, how did you break the cycle of endless manual regression testing?

And in another Reddit thread, someone's looking for practical advice on how to start cultivating a culture of automation for repetitive testing tasks.

reddit.com

Test Tag Suggestions Using AI

What if AI could choose tests to run based on your pull request description? Gleb Bahmutov demonstrates such a solution in detail.

Moreover, Davide Consonni describes the potential approaches to Building Intelligent Automation with AI Agents.

glebbahmutov.com

Write tests that tell the story

Rahul R gives several pieces of advice on how to write good tests, including attention to naming, structure and logic.

rahulrpandya.in

Sponsored Link

Still Waiting on That One API to Test? Mock It in Seconds with Requestly

Stuck because an API isn't ready or keeps breaking? Requestly â€” now backed by BrowserStack â€” lets you mock and modify HTTP requests right in your browser. No proxy setup. No SSL hassle. Just faster testing, fewer blockers, and more control. Built for QAs who hate waiting. Get started for free!

requestly.com

TOOLS

Advanced Playwright Patterns: Parallel Testing and Resource Management

Wondering how to effectively run Playwright tests in parallel? Peyman Iravani shows how to achieve that in this detailed guide.

medium.com

Getting started with PactumJS: Project Structure and Your First Test Case

PactumJS is a popular open-source tool for API testing, and here's a concise overview by Eleonora Belova explaining how to integrate and run tests with it.

noraweisser.com

Lessons in quality engineering from working with Cursor and Windsurf

There's a lot of buzz around AI-powered IDEs such as Cursor and Windsurf. But how do they impact the quality of code development? Mark Winteringham shares his thoughts after testing both tools.

ministryoftesting.com

Meet the New CYPRESS-SCHEMA-VALIDATOR: When ZOD Joined Forces with AJV for the Ultimate Validation Duo!

If you use Cypress for API testing, you'll be happy to hear that Sebastian Clavijo Suero released a new, open-source tool for API schema validation â€” cypress-schema-validator.

dev.to

Python Unit Test on database with Testcontainers

Need to test scripts that do database operations? Gavin Fong describes how he created a solution with Python and Testcontainers to achieve that.

Additionally, Ayoub Bounaga shows How to Filter Pytest Tests Gracefully.

medium.com

VIDEOS

Agentic AI in Software Testing: Meet TestZeus Hercules

Have you heard of TestZeus Hercules? In this 12-minute video, Daniel Knott describes the open-source testing agent.

youtube.com

Quality Assurance Jobs in USA â€” June 2025 Update

I appreciate Alex Khvastovich's consistent, biannual updates on the QA job market. Here's the latest one!

youtube.com

AND...

A true tester... ğŸ˜‚

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 272 - May 26th 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬272æœŸ - 2025å¹´5æœˆ26æ—¥
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 272nd issue!

There's a race not only among the commercial AI-powered testing solutions.

The open-source landscape is buzzing too.

How? Well, here's The State of Open-Source AI-Powered Test Automation.

Alex Rodionov shows examples of various tools, categorised as test generators, test runners and test libraries, such as LaVague, Shortest and Alumnium.

Interesting times! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

Testmo â€” Built For Modern Test Management

With Testmo, you can document test cases, track test runs & exploratory sessions, and report on test automation results in real-time â€” all from one platform that your team will actually enjoy using. Affordable for teams of all sizes with outstanding support & reliability. Start a free trial to see for yourself!

testmo.com

NEWS

Accessibility Testing for Mobile Apps: Are You Missing These Critical Checks?

With the new regulation coming to Europe, testing for accessibility is becoming increasingly important. So it's great to see practical advice from Mona M. Abd El-Rahman on how to do that on mobile.

Moreover, Michael Kennedy shares several Empathy lessons for software testers: Preparing for the European Accessibility Act.

medium.com

AI and Deterministic Testing

Testing the way we've always known it might not apply to AI-based apps. Dick Dowdell describes in detail why and explains how to approach it instead.

Also, there's a good reminder from Sarat Ramineni that Testing isn't dead. It got smarter.

medium.com

Being a Solo QA with Daily Deployments: How to Survive and Still Build a Quality Process

Following last week's article, Jyan Swan shared another interesting point of view on what it is like to be a sole tester in a team.

Furthermore, Ä°lay Ä°nan Ãœnal has some good insights into Dancing with Requirements: The QA Engineer's Hidden Superpower.

medium.com

How to Report Quality Metrics to Top Management (Without Putting Them to Sleep)

It's hard to set good quality metrics, and so is making them relevant and visible. But Ivan Boklach has some good tips on that.

medium.com

Let's Rethink the Role of QA â€” It's Not About Owning Quality

Xinyu Zhang makes some good points about a tester's evolving role in modern software development and proposes to lean towards Integration Assurance instead.

Similarly, Marina JordÃ£o sheds some light on QA 2.0: As Companies Kill QA, a New Role Is Rising â€” The Quality Architect.

medium.com

AUTOMATION

Behind the Green Check: A Guide to Test Doubles

Wondering how test doubles â€” such as mocks, stubs and fakes â€” can help you in testing? Puti Raissa put together a comprehensive guide.

Also, Shubham Sharma explains why Mocking Dependencies in Your E2E Tests is Key to Effective E2E Testing.

medium.com

How Component-Based Testing Can Future-Proof Your Enterprise UI and API Automation

You've probably heard about the Page Object Model. But what if we broke down pages into components? Kavita Jadhav explains this approach and its advantages.

Furthermore, Jack Bentley shows examples of Creating a Page Object Model in Cypress.

medium.com

How do I transition from manual testing to automation?

If you want to learn test automation but are unsure where to start â€” you're not alone. Someone asked this question on Reddit and got some good advice from the testing community.

reddit.com

Test-Driven Development: The Key to Building Reliable and Scalable Software

And if you wonder what Test-Driven Development is about, Muhammad Hilal Darul Fauzan has put together a comprehensive guide with examples.

medium.com

The Testing Tower

We've heard about many test shapes describing test strategy so far: pyramids, honeycombs, trophies... but what about a tower? Jose Maria Flores Zazo shows an interesting point of view.

medium.com

TOOLS

Can tools really "simulate user behaviour"?

Michael Bolton shared a very good point on what it takes to properly test our apps from the user's perspective and why tools such as Selenium, Cypress, and Playwright might not fully do that for us.

linkedin.com

Lesser known strengths of Playwright

Playwright has a lot of great built-in features, but do you know about them? Anjali Kulkarni describes some of the powerful, but not necessarily the most obvious ones.

And if you want to test how your web app performs when offline, Irfan MujagiÄ‡ wrote a helpful guide to Testing Cached Data with Playwright.

medium.com

UI Test Automation Beginner's Guide: Selenium IDE & XPath Without Coding

Want to start with testing using Selenium? Danyil Antoniuk put together a multiple-part guide to setting it up and running it. You can also read the second and third parts.

medium.com

VIDEOS

Playwright.NET now Supports XUnit â€” Officially!

One of the main advantages of Playwright is that we can use different languages to implement the tests. For those of you preferring C# and .NET environment, Karthik K.K. highlights the recent official support for XUnit.

youtube.com

Remote Working Software Testing Challenges

While remote work is becoming more common than ever, it's important to know its benefits and challenges, especially in software testing. Daniel Knott explains this in a 14-minute video.

youtube.com

AND...

Well, good newsâ€¦ ğŸ˜‚

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 270 - May 14th 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬270æœŸ - 2025å¹´5æœˆ14æ—¥
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 270th issue!

This got my attention â€” What are your thoughts on the future of QA role?

It's a discussion about the evolving responsibilities and expectations of testers and developers during the software development lifecycle.

Should testers become enablers of testing rather than entirely focused on testing?

Perhaps â€” at least that's more in line with the Modern Testing Principles.

But keep in mind that different companies require different approaches; there's no one-size-fits-all.

Happy testing! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

Testmo â€” Now with Jira Coverage & Traceability

Testmo is the #1 unified test management tool designed to help your team be more productive and efficient with testing. Now even better with full coverage and traceability for your user stories, epics, and other issues tracked in Jira â€” or any other tool your team might use to manage requirements! Sign up for a free trial and see for yourself just how easy it is to streamline your testing with Testmo.

testmo.com

NEWS

In Software, Delivery Is Just the Beginning

That's a good reminder from Alessandra Moreira about what practices to follow after the software is shipped to mitigate degradation in its quality.

About that, Aya Akl wrote a decent article about Shifting Quality Into High Gear, both left and right.

roadlesstested.com

Product Quality for Non-Technical Founders

Simon Knight provides helpful templates and good advice to founders and members of the leadership team on assessing quality.

Speaking of providing the right information to the ones higher up, Mona M. Abd El-Rahman wrote a wonderful piece about Bug Advocacy 101: Make Sure Your Bugs Get the Attention They Deserve.

sjpknight.com

QA to QE: Rethinking Quality in the Age of AI

Simon Prior gives real-world examples and highlights why and how testers should adopt new AI-related practices, tools, and ways of working.

Also, James Bach shares some interesting thoughts: Is There Something in Your "I"?

leadtestinclude.com

Quality Engineering as philosophy, a framework and a tool

This is a fine explanation of what Quality Engineering is and why it's important. By Jitesh Gosai.

substack.com

Using an Agile definition of done to promote a quality culture

Emily O'Connor shares a comprehensive overview of the processes and criteria that should be part of the definition of done.

Furthermore, Ä°lay Ä°nan Ãœnal rightly points out that If There's No Time for Testing at the End of the Sprint, There's No Time Management at All.

ministryoftesting.com

AUTOMATION

Building a Rock-Solid Testing Framework at Bynry

Curious about how other companies approach test automation? Harsh Jha demonstrates what they included in their test automation framework.

Also, Muhammet Topcu wraps up a long series of articles on Creating End-to-End Web Test Automation Project from Scratch â€” Part 6.

medium.com

How Testing Became My Code's Lifeline

Roy Chanunkha shares an insightful perspective on how testing helps them during software development.

Moreover, Reza Akbar Attariq describes the F.I.R.S.T. Unit Testing Principle That You Need to Know

medium.com

From Requests to Reports: Clean Logging in API Testing

How complete is your API testing framework? Sai Anudeep Adimulapu shows how to build a decent solution with logging and reporting in the JavaScript tech stack, using several open-source tools.

dev.to

Why Code Coverage Matters For a Quality Culture (Part 1)

There are many great points brought up by Melissa Eaden about the importance of caring for code, the coverage metrics and the usefulness of dashboards and reports. You can learn more in the second part.

A good follow-up read to that is Petr PlavjanÃ­k's insights into Code Coverage: What the Experts Really Think.

substack.com

Sponsored Link

Streamlined 2FA Testing with Mailsac

Manual 2FA testing slowing you down? See how Mailsac and Selenium can capture authentication emails, extract OTPs, and test every edge case automatically.

mailsac.com

TOOLS

How AI Agents Are Transforming UI and API Test Automation in 2025

Wondering what open-source AI tools and solutions are getting traction in software testing? Saurabh Srivastava put together an overview of some of them.

In relation to that â€” How do you use AI in your QA teams?

medium.com

How to Use localStorage with Playwright (Complete Tutorial with Examples)

The window.localStorage property is frequently used by web apps. Priyanshu Shekhar shows several ways of leveraging it in Playwright tests.

In another article, Priyanshu also advises to Stop Carrying Selenium Habits to Playwright.

qaexpertise.com

PITest â€” a Handsâ€‘On Guide to Mutation Testing in Java

PIT is a powerful tool for mutation testing Java code. Eduardo Kobus demonstrates how to set it up and run with examples.

medium.com

Speeding Up Playwright Tests with Dynamic Sharding in GitHub Actions

There's some good advice from Lewis Nelson on how to speed up Playwright test execution on CI.

Another way to achieve that might be Handling Multi-User Flows in Playwright the Right Way, as Mariam Sargsyan suggests.

medium.com

The Async Nature of Cypress: Don't Mess with the Timelines in Your Cypress Tests 'Dual-Verse'

Cypress, as a JavaScript-based tool, relies a lot on async implementation. Sebastian Clavijo Suero wrote a very thorough overview demonstrating what it entails.

dev.to

VIDEOS

Exploratory Testing with AI

A lot of people use AI to improve test automation. That's fair, but Gil Zilberfeld takes a different point of view, checking how it can help with exploratory testing, too.

youtu.be

MCP Server: Test UI, DB and API of Application with ZERO code in Claude, Cursor and Copilot

Karthik K.K. continues the series of videos demonstrating various AI solutions applicable to software testing. Here's another example of using MCPs to test across different layers of a web application with AI.

youtube.com

AND...

Edge cases... ğŸ˜‚

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

ã€‚

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 271 - May 20th 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬271æœŸ - 2025å¹´5æœˆ20æ—¥
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 271st issue!

Looking for a new software testing job?

Today, I want to highlight some recent advice from the community:

  • What makes a Test Engineer's resume stand out?
  • How to Build a Professional LinkedIn Profile as a QA Engineer? by Vladimir Josifoski

Happy job hunting and happy testing! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

Reimagining Testing: Testsigma Brings Autonomous Testing and AI Agents for All QA Teams

Testsigma, a leading cloud-based testing platform, announced Autonomous Testing capabilities â€” with AI coworkers that help QA teams plan, generate, execute, and maintain tests faster, with humans in the loop.

It also launched AI-native Test Management System, enabling manual testing teams to turn Jira or Figma inputs into test cases, execute them in-browser, and file detailed bug reports (screenshots, logs, repro steps) to Jira in one click, cutting days of effort to seconds. Explore the new Test Management platform for free!

testsigma.com

NEWS

A Beginner's Guide: API Testing in the world of Microservices

Continuing the series on API testing, this time Aya Akl describes why it's crucial in a microservices architecture and explains how to approach it.

medium.com

A letter to the hiring manager of software testers: 10 years later

What would help companies and testers have a better hiring experience? Gabbi Trotter gives some good advice to those who are hiring.

Moreover, Yanina Kozlova shares interesting thoughts on How to Lead a QA Interview in the Age of AI.

ministryoftesting.com

A Solo Tester's Guide to Building a Quality-First Culture

How is it to be the only tester in the team, or even in the company? Mona M. Abd El-Rahman shares her experience and gives several valuable tips on how to handle such a situation.

Similarly, Callum Akehurst-Ryan describes a Quality Coaching Scenario: No testing happening and Wendy Erdheim-Poch advises on the Collaboration of QA in a Dev World.

medium.com

Do technical or non-technical testers deliver more value?

This is a concise message from Jason Arbon stating that the most important part of a tester's job is to deliver value â€” regardless of whether it's achieved via tools or hands-on execution.

It's also crucial to Own Your Impact: Mastering Accomplishments in Software QA, as Sarat Ramineni explains.

linkedin.com

From QA Lead to Manager: My Journey and What I Learned

If you're thinking of becoming a QA Manager, Brijendra Singh shares insights into being one and how the role differs from being an individual contributor.

medium.com

AUTOMATION

How to use mocks and stubs to write faster and safer tests

Wondering how test doubles can help you test more effectively? Wahyu Hidayat explains with examples.

And if you want to see more of it in practice, Pradap Pandiyan demonstrates Mocking API Testing with JSON Server, Faker & JS in Gitlab CI.

medium.com

Our Recipe for Developing Good Automated Tests

Anton Oboleninov describes in detail their journey to setting up a test automation solution. Interestingly, they chose Selenium over Playwright since it better fits their use case.

Also, Chamila Ambahera wants us to remember that Good Test Automation Doesn't Start with Code.

medium.com

Testing in Android Kotlin Projects: A Practical Guide

Ebrar Tikit shares lots of helpful tips about testing Android applications on several levels. Examples included.

medium.com

Things I Wish I Knew When I Started Testing Spring Boot Applications

There are some interesting insights from Philip Riecks about testing Spring Boot apps built with Java. Philip has also previously shared the Top 5 Spring Boot Testing Myths.

rieckpil.de

We Built a Shared Test Automation Infrastructure for Web Projects â€” Here's How We Did It

Yet another story of building a test automation solution. This time, Ahmet ÅimÅŸek describes their approach, including tooling, tagging, CI and more.

medium.com

Sponsored Link

API dependencies slowing down your tests? You need WireMock Cloud

Test more and test faster with WireMock's enterprise-grade API simulation platform. Create realistic mocks including complex failure states to decouple integration testing from API dependencies. Get rid of expensive test environments and unreliable sandboxes. Start now on the free-forever edition.

wiremock.io

TOOLS

Count Me Out & Assert Me Wrong: Two Sneaky Playwright Pitfalls

Islam Taha describes the challenges with making their Playwright tests stable and what they learned from that. You can also catch up on the first part about Fighting False Alerts in Our Playwright Test Suite.

medium.com

Knowing when the battle is lost with XCUITests

Writing UI tests for iOS apps? Chris Mash shows an intriguing implementation of a test failure observer that automatically halts the XCTest test suite after a certain number of tests fail.

medium.com

Mastering Soft Assertions in Cypress: The Power of .should() with Custom Functions and the Need for Better Solutions

Sometimes you may not want a single failure to stop your test execution. Mohamed Said Ibrahim gives a good overview of several ways to implement a soft assertion in Cypress.

medium.com

Reliable, predictable, and scalable performance testing: Grafana k6 1.0 is here

It's a big day for Graphana k6! After nearly a decade, this popular performance testing tool has finally got its 1.0 version. ThÃ©o Crevon tells us more about the key updates.

grafana.com

What makes PactumJS awesome? A quick look at its best features

Testing APIs with JavaScript? Eleonora Belova describes what makes PactumJS â€” an open-source test framework â€” so helpful.

noraweisser.com

VIDEOS

Android Testing Strategies

Jose AlcÃ©rreca from the official Android Developers channel gives a high-level, 8-minute overview of test strategies for Android apps.

Jose has also recorded a short overview of Tools and patterns for scalable Android app testing.

youtube.com

How to Generate Playwright Tests using MCP + Copilot

In this short, 3-minute recording, Debbie O'Brien demonstrates how to easily use MCP and GitHub Copilot to implement Playwright tests.

And if you want to go deeper, check out Karthik K.K.'s 10-minute overview of Parallel Playwright Testing with Browser Use + Multi-LLM Support: The Future is Here.

youtube.com

AND...

VibeCon... ğŸ¤£

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 278 - Jul 21st 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬278æœŸ - 7æœˆ21æ—¥2025
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome back to the 278th issue after a two-week holiday break!

Today, I'm pleased to share some news with you about salaries and the QA job market.

Firstly, here's a recent, substantial 2025 Salary Reference where testers from around the world shared their salaries.

Secondly, listen to an insightful conversation about the State of the Software Testing Job Market in 2025 by Alan Richardson and Jack Cole.

Enjoy and happy testing! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

From PRD to Automated Test in Minutes: How BrowserStack's AI Agents are Changing Testing Workflows

With BrowserStack's Test Case Generator Agent, just drop in your PRD or user story â€” AI instantly generates detailed, context-aware test cases, cutting test planning time by over 90%. Then, the Low-Code Authoring Agent picks it up from there, turning those cases into reliable automated tests 10x faster without writing a single line of code. Try for free!

browserstack.com

NEWS

QA in the Age of AI: More Than Just Survival

Yash Patil shares a reflection on how AI is changing QA and why the human side of testing still matters.

At the same time, Julia Kocbek advises us to Test smart: how to escape burnout?.

medium.com

Testers have to be the ones to advocate for quality

This is a very important message from Callum Akehurst-Ryan outlining the crucial role that testers play in software development.

Moreover, Sodeeq Elusoji wrote a thought-provoking article about a Bug in Production â€” If QA Can't Be Blamed, Why Do We Have QA?.

cakehurstryan.com

Testing in Production

It's not easy and requires a lot of preparation, but sometimes it's worth it. Here's a good high-level overview by Daniel McNamee explaining what it takes.

scottlogic.com

Ticket by Ticket, Not Person by Person: The Daily Stand-Up Shift That Builds the QA Culture that Your Team Needs

How does your team do standups? Marina JordÃ£o shares several good tips on how to make them more effective with a focus on quality.

Also, what happens when Devs can't take on QA work? This is an interesting discussion among the testing community that continues in a twin thread.

medium.com

What's Next in QA? A Complete Guide to Career Growth

If you're looking for advice, inspiration or direction for your QA career growth, Mona M. Abd El-Rahman wrote a helpful guide.

Also, you may want to learn from someone else's experience â€” Do Not Join a Services Based Company as a Sole QA.

medium.com

AUTOMATION

5 steps to a deterministic test suite

Tom Perry shares good, pragmatic advice to improve your test automation, based on their experience. It includes metrics, modularisation, tackling flakiness and investing in insightful reporting.

medium.com

AI-Powered Test Generation and Maintenance

If you're looking for an example of using AI in testing, Peyman Iravani shares extensive code snippets for test generation, execution prioritisation and test analysis.

Furthermore, Lamhot Siagian shows how to build a Self-Healing Test Framework for API Testing.

medium.com

Beyond Testing: Why Quality Engineers Must Master CI/CD, DevOps, and DevSecOps

Nowadays, engineers are expected to obtain DevOps-related skills. Mona M. Abd El-Rahman explains why it may benefit test engineers, too.

Also, Chamelo Ai outlines the Quality as Code: Infrastructure and Automation Patterns for Modern QE.

medium.com

Mastering Test Design Techniques in Software Testing

Are you familiar with black-box and white-box testing? Anil Goyal describes these important techniques with examples.

medium.com

Why I'm Betting on LLMs for UI Testing

Carlos Arguelles, an experienced engineer in big tech companies, shares very interesting thoughts on why AI may be a good solution for automating UI testing.

linkedin.com

TOOLS

Copilot Pull Request Reviews For Testability

Did you know you can use GitHub Copilot to review your pull requests? Gleb Bahmutov demonstrates a real example of that.

Furthermore, Mirza Å iÅ¡iÄ‡ has an interesting read about Low-code test automation tools: First impressions and recommendations for beginners.

glebbahmutov.com

How to Integrate Cypress with FTP, SFTP, and S3 for End-to-End Testing?

Sometimes you may need to use external file storage for your tests. Clark Ewerton shows how to do that with Cypress.

Similarly, Yash Patil explains how to integrate Cypress Tests With AWS Secrets Manager.

medium.com

Jenkins At Scale: How We Build A Scalable, Modular, and Self-Healing Test Infrastructure Across Our Projects

Is Jenkins your CI? Kamna Pamnani and Venkatesh Gopalakrishnan describe in detail how they used it to create a self-healing test automation solution.

medium.com

Lesser known strengths of Playwright

You may already know a lot about Playwright, but have you leveraged the full potential of the network interception feature? Anjali Kulkarni gives a great overview of it.

Also, you may wonder: Which has better job openings, Selenium or Playwright?

medium.com

VIDEOS

Generating Playwright Tests With AI: Let's Try the New Playwright MCP Server!

In this 11-minute video, Stefan Judis shows how to automate tests using AI and Playwright MCP.

Also, Alex Khvastovich created a step-by-step video guide to Page Object Model (POM) in Playwright.

youtube.com

AND...

Testing with AI... ğŸ˜‚

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 276 - Jun 24th 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬276æœŸ - 2025å¹´6æœˆ24æ—¥
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 276th issue!

Have you heard of Stagehand?

It's a new open-source AI automation framework that operates on just three main commands and leverages Playwright to inspect and execute actions in the browser.

If you want to learn more, Yatheendra Sai wrote a helpful article describing it in more detail.

It's good to see more such solutions emerging. I'm convinced we may hear more about them in the future.

Happy testing! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

You can now run Playwright tests on real iOS devices with Safari

Playwright users can now test on real iPhones and iPads with Safari. BrowserStack's latest launch lets you run parallel tests across 1000+ device-browser combinations, capture logs, videos, and text reports in one place, and simulate real-world conditions to ensure full coverage. Run your first test here!

browserstack.com

NEWS

Adding software testers successfully to any product team: Experiences, struggles, and tips

Demi Van Malcot shares several helpful tips on how to properly integrate QA people and processes into a product engineering team.

Moreover, James Kip explains Why Traditional SDET Interviews Are Broken (and How to Fix Them) in the first place.

ministryoftesting.com

High-level Test Planning â€” The Content

Following the first part, Gil Zilberfeld continues sharing good advice on test planning, focusing specifically on what it should include.

Also, Jayateerth Katti explains why Zero bugs doesn't mean you are lazy. It shows your guardrails worked.

everydayunittesting.com

It's about quality, not testing

Jitesh Gosai correctly points out that there's more to achieving software quality than just testing and advises on what to focus on as well.

Similarly, Sarat Ramineni wrote a good article about Quantity â‰  Quality: Why More Testing Won't Save Your Product.

substack.com

Maintaining Quality While GenAI Rewrites Everything

AI is all around software engineering, and we have to accept it and adapt our testing and quality practices to it. Wendy Erdheim-Poch shares some good advice on that.

Furthermore, Jeff Nyman writes about Quality Assurance for Society in the age of AI.

medium.com

Tester Said No to Bad Release & Saved the Product

"Quality Is Everyone's Job, But QA Leads the Way."

A good reminder from George Ukkuru about why it's important to highlight challenges effectively while exploring and testing the system.

On the other hand, Alessandra Moreira mentions some of The Words That Break Software.

medium.com

AUTOMATION

API Testing Integration: Combining REST APIs with UI Automation

How would you test the integration between the UI and API of the web app? Peyman Iravani shows extensive examples of achieving that in JavaScript.

Furthermore, Peyman also wrote about Advanced JavaScript Testing Strategies for Modern Web Applications.

medium.com

How to Learn Test Automation Without Stress or Panic (Even If You Hate Coding)

If you're starting your journey with test automation, Mona M. Abd El-Rahman gives several good tips on how to do it effectively, step by step.

medium.com

Non-functional criteria for framework choices

Choosing a test framework isn't only about comparing features. Benjamin Bischoff explains that other factors should be taken into account, such as team expertise, documentation, culture, and maintenance.

Also, What If Your Tests Healed Themselves Overnight? Harpreet Sohal shares how it could be achieved.

softwaretester.blog

Who Is Responsible for the Return Code in an API? A Tester's Perspective

While testing APIs, you may encounter various HTTP codes. Elena Voevodkina explains why using the right ones matters for clarity, automation, and future maintenance.

medium.com

TOOLS

Cypress 14 with Lighthouse â€” Part 2

Kishor Munot demonstrates how to automatically measure website performance metrics using two open-source tools â€” Cypress and Lighthouse from Google. You can also read the first part, which explains how Lighthouse works.

medium.com

One Test, Two Wins: Run UI and Accessibility Tests from Your Playwright Page Objects with @axeScan()

Need to test your web app for accessibility? Yevhenii Otsevych proposes a new way of doing it based on the Page Object Model by using the open-source library he created â€” axe-playwright-report.

Also, Arthur Tee Seng Tuan wrote a helpful guide to Performance Testing with Playwright and Artillery.

medium.com

What's New in Playwright v1.52 & v1.53: Fix with AI, Describable Locators, and More!

Debbie O'Brien announces that Playwright 1.53 is here and it brings some exciting features and improvements to trace viewer, HTML reporter, assertions and more.

Similarly, Shivam Bharadwaj shares What's New in Playwright v1.53.0.

dev.to

Why Playwright Tracing Beats Logging for Debugging UI Tests

Siarhei Shukalovich has an interesting point of view on how to enhance your Playwright test tracing and debugging.

Also, Debbie O'Brien describes the new way of Debugging Playwright Tests with AI: A Smarter, Faster Workflow.

plainenglish.io

BOOKS

AI in Software Testing Starter Pack

Want to learn more about AI in testing but don't know where to start? Keith Klain collected several recommendations in the form of books and other resources.

qualityremarks.com

VIDEOS

Playwright TypeScript â€” Part 6: Playwright UI Visual Testing

Alex Khvastovich has been working on a helpful introductory course for Playwright. Here's a 20-minute overview of implementing visual tests, followed by Part 7 about Accessibility Testing.

youtube.com

AND...

QA jokes... ğŸ˜‚

Thanks for reading!

If you like this newsletter and it helps you become a better tester, you can say thanks and buy me a coffee.

Dawid Dylowicz

This RSS feed is published on https://softwaretestingweekly.com/. You can also subscribe via email.

item.title: ã€Software Testing Weekly - Issue 279 - Aug 9th 2025ã€‘è½¯ä»¶æµ‹è¯•æ¯å‘¨ - ç¬¬279æœŸ - 2025å¹´8æœˆ9æ—¥
item.description:
ã€

COMMENT

Welcome to the 279th issue!

Working in Big Tech is a dream of many. And it's possible!

This time, I want to share with you an inspiring story of How I got "that" job at Microsoft.

It's by Gaurav Singh â€” an SDET who worked in several top tech companies.

In preparation for that, Gaurav also shared some great advice on the interview process:

  • How to ace your QA Tech interview
  • How to negotiate your tech job salary

Good luck and happy testing! ğŸ™‚

Dawid Dylowicz

Sponsored Link

Navigate the AI Revolution in Software Quality

Agentic AI is reinventing the entire software development lifecycle â€” how are you adapting? Join a forward-thinking community of quality teams at Experience 2025 to chart the course the rest of the industry will follow. Save 25% on your ticket with code MX25OFF; register by 8/20 to save.

mabl.com

NEWS

Managing the Consequences of the 'Ship Now, Fix Later' Approach

Daria Kotelenets shares an extensive guide on how managing known problems, technical debt, and defects can improve the overall system quality.

Moreover, Ahmed El-Deeb has some good points on why QA Doesn't Belong at the End â€” and What to Do About it.

medium.com

Quality Coaching Scenario: This code won't take tests

How should you test untestable code? Callum Akehurst-Ryan explains how flipping the testing pyramid and focusing on exploratory and characterisation testing can help with it.

Also, Jitesh Gosai discusses: What if We Talked About Confidence in QA?.

cakehurstryan.com

What To Do When There's "Nothing to Test"

Vladimir Josifoski describes other activities outside of testing that you can do to deliver value to the team.

Similarly, Joep Schuurkes shares a reflection about Some of the things I did after being off for a few weeks.

qalogy.com

Why I Like to Think Like the End-User When Testing a Feature

In this concise article, Higor Mesquita shares good tips on how to think like a user and highlights how it can help the overall product quality.

This is followed by Ravisuriya Eswara's article about Empathy â€” Missing in Engineers. Then, Why Think Like a User?.

medium.com

Why is there no Chief Quality Officer?

An excellent question! Katja Obring shares interesting thoughts about it, while Rosie Sherry decided to expand this topic by sharing her views in an article about Quality Leadership Roles â€” what's the real story?.

Similarly, Simon Knight outlines The Smart Founder's Testing Strategy that's also related to this topic.

kato-coaching.com

AUTOMATION

Code Coverage And Other Metrics

In another article of the series, Gil Zilberfeld explains why code coverage or any other metric alone should decide about the release readiness.

In relation to that, Sourojit Das shares a story of a project where The Code Was 100% Tested â€” And 100% Broken.

everydayunittesting.com

Does This Look Right To You, AI?

Can AI test a web app? Gleb Bahmutov decided to verify and see how good it is at interpreting and asserting according to feature requirements.

Also, Abdelkader Hassine shares the experience of Replacing Some Test Automation Assertions With GPT-4o API.

glebbahmutov.com

Page Object Model vs Page Factory in E2E Test Automation

If you wonder how these test automation design patterns compare, Courtney Zhan describes both of them and explains her preference.

In relation to that, Sergey Shukalovich wrote a short UI Testing Locators Guide: How to Write Stable and Maintainable Selectors.

substack.com

Test code should rarely be resilient

Good advice from John Gluck on writing tests that fail fast and not using exceptions in them to reveal the real problems.

Moreover, Dennis Martinez thoroughly explains the benefits of practising Pull Request-Driven Development: More Clarity, Better Code.

qaclub.io

Why You Should Test with Real Data (Sometimes)

Do you use mocks in test automation? Irfan MujagiÄ‡ emphasises why you need to choose wisely when to rely on it, and when to use real data.

Similarly, James Thomas wrote about relying on Real vs Clear test data models.

thegreenreport.blog

TOOLS

AgentiTest â€” AI-Native Test Automation is Here

If you're looking for ways to do test automation with AI, you might be interested in a new open-source solution â€” AgentiTest â€” created by Google Cloud engineer, Karl Weinmeister.

medium.com

Building a Robust Automation Framework with Playwright, TypeScript & Cucumber

Well, this is comprehensive! Rajesh Yemul put a lot of effort into documenting the journey of setting up a web test automation framework with Playwright and Cucumber. You can check out all the consecutive parts: 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10.

medium.com

How does Playwright MCP work?

It's a wonderful, detailed explanation by SÅ‚awomir RadzymiÅ„ski of how the Playwright MCP really works underneath. You can learn a lot from it.

awesome-testing.com

Your Complete k6 Implementation Guide: From Reactive to Proactive

Once again, Hariprasath V S goes deep into exploring k6 capabilities for performance testing and shares the findings in this thorough overview.

medium.com

The API Automation framework I wish I had known sooner

Millan Kaul demonstrates the key features of the API test automation framework built with TypeScript and leveraging some of the Playwright features.

github.io

VIDEOS

Quality Assurance Roadmap: Become a QA Engineer in 2025

Whether you're looking for guidance on how to become a tester or want to progress in your career, Alex Khvastovich gives a good overview of a QA roadmap in this 17-minute video.

youtube.com

Will AI Replace QA? Top 5 Questions Answered!

We often hear questions and opinions about AI replacing QA. Having worked with AI for testing and development, Karthik K.K. breaks it down and addresses the most common concerns.

Speaking of AI, Daniel Knott recorded a handy guide to AI prompts that boost your bug reporting.

youtube.com

AND...
